resources.string: This small neighborhood park has up to date equipment and plenty of shade. Parking spots are limited, so plan on parking in on a nearby street and walking. There is a single swing set with two swings for adults, and two for small children. A small playground area contains a fun obstacle course and a well kept play set. A basketball court and a small public restroom round out this secluded park. \n\nTypically, there are only a few people at the park at any time which lends itself to relaxed play time for small children.
Suitable for small children and toddlers
Has an exit close to a street

North Rose Hill Woodlands Park, or Castle Park as it is also known, has a wonderful play area with a large castle like play set. The rest of the park is open with a wooden walkway that winds through a wooded area. \n\nParking is very limited for a park of this size, and the entrances are somewhat hidden if you are not familiar with the area.
Suitable for small children and toddlers

Located near downtown Kirkland, this vibrant park is almost always teaming with people. The play area, a skate park, tennis courts, a baseball diamond, public swimming pool, and central location ensure that there will almost always be something to do. \n\nPlenty of open space means that there is not much escape from the sun on hotter days. Fortunately, the Kirkland Library is adjacent to the park and offers a nice escape from the heat. Many local shops and restaurants are also within walking distance.
Public pool, skate park, and baseball field

Terrace Park is a small, out of the way neighborhood park. While its play area is relatively small, the generally attendance makes it feel like you have your own private park. \n\nThere is swing set and small play set for young children, and a basketball court. The Cross Kirkland Corridor winds nearby, and a large open field is nice for running and playing with the kids.

Located close to the Microsoft campus in Redmond, Grass Lawn Park is an vast, and busy park. It boasts multiple sporting areas (tennis courts, soccer fields, baseball diamond, and basketball courts), a large open area with a pavilion for group events, paved walkways, and two playgrounds. \n\nWith all of the amenities and its convenient location, Grass Lawn Park can be extremely crowded at times. While there are two parking lots, they tend to fill up quickly so get there early or be prepared to park in a nearby neighborhood and walk.
Can be extremely crowded at times
